chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
discrete nat

Premises:
discrete = fun X : Type => decidable (fun '(x, y) => x = y) : Type -> Prop Arguments discrete _%type_scope
discrete_iff : forall X : Type, discrete X < -> inhabited (eq_dec X)
discrete_bool = let H : forall X : Type, inhabited (eq_dec X) -> discrete X := fun X : Type => match discrete_iff X with | conj _ x0 => x0 end in H bool (inhabits bool_eq_dec) : discrete bool
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Nat.land = fun a b : nat => Nat.bitwise andb a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.land (_ _)%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.setbit = fun a n : nat => PeanoNat.Nat.lor a (PeanoNat.Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.setbit (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Nat.bitwise orb (Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lor (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.lxor = fun a b : nat => Nat.bitwise xorb (Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lxor (_ _)%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.lcm = fun a b : nat => a * PeanoNat.Nat.div b (PeanoNat.Nat.gcd a b) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.lcm (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.square = fun n : nat => n * n : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.square _%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.ones = fun n : nat => PeanoNat.Nat.pred (PeanoNat.Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.ones _%nat_scope
Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Nat.log2_iter (Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
List.list_max = fun l : list nat => List.fold_right Nat.max 0 l : list nat -> nat Arguments List.list_max _%list_scope
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.shiftl = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => Nat.double) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Arguments Nat.shiftl (_ _)%nat_scope
Plus.tail_plus = fix tail_plus (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n0 => tail_plus n0 (S m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Plus.tail_plus (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.pred _%nat_scope
nat_rect_plus : forall (n m : nat) (A : Type) (f : A -> A) (x : A), nat_rect (fun _ : nat => A) x (fun _ : nat => f) (n + m) = nat_rect (fun _ : nat => A) (nat_rect (fun _ : nat => A) x (fun _ : nat => f) m) (fun _ : nat => f) n
Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (Nat.modulo b (S a')) (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.gcd (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.sqrt_iter = fix sqrt_iter (k p q r : nat) {struct k} : nat := match k with | 0 => p | S k' => match r with | 0 => sqrt_iter k' (S p) (S (S q)) (S (S q)) | S r' => sqrt_iter k' p q r' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.sqrt_iter (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.odd = fun n : nat => negb (Nat.even n) : nat -> bool Arguments Nat.odd _%nat_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.sqrt_up = fun a : nat => match PeanoNat.Nat.compare 0 a with | Lt => S (PeanoNat.Nat.sqrt (PeanoNat.Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.sqrt_up _%nat_scope
Factorial.fact = fix fact (n : nat) : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => S n0 * fact n0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Factorial.fact _%nat_scope
Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.min = fix min (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S n' => match m with | 0 => 0 | S m' => S (min n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.min (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.bitwise = fix bitwise (op : bool -> bool -> bool) (n a b : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S n' => (if op (Nat.odd a) (Nat.odd b) then 1 else 0) + 2 * bitwise op n' (Nat.div2 a) (Nat.div2 b) end : (bool -> bool -> bool) -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.bitwise _%function_scope (_ _ _)%nat_scope

length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
ByteVector.ByteVector = Vector.t Ascii.ascii : nat -> Set Arguments ByteVector.ByteVector _%nat_scope
Bvector.Bvector = Vector.t bool : nat -> Set Arguments Bvector.Bvector _%nat_scope
List.repeat : forall A : Type, A -> nat -> list A
